introText: The Ministry of Energy oversees Ontario's electricity system, energy policy, and programs to ensure reliable, affordable, and clean energy for homes, businesses, and communities across the province.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Energy spent $6.3B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 3.1% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports electricity price mitigation, energy programs, and system reliability.
roleText: Energy is fundamental to Ontario's economy and daily life. This ministry manages electricity policy, supports energy affordability programs, and works to ensure a reliable and increasingly clean energy system for all Ontarians.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Energy operates programs including the Ontario Electricity Rebate, rural rate protection, Indigenous energy partnerships, energy efficiency initiatives, and electricity system planning.
